title: Boxing For Beginners: A Guide To Competition & Fitness
features: Master Boxing Basics While Getting into Shape
Whether you want to learn the core principles of boxing or simply get into better shape,
Boxing for Beginners
is the personal trainer you've been looking for.
Golden Gloves champion
Billy Finegan

covers everything from the standard equipment you need to get started to the basic workouts and punching drills you need to know before heading into the ring. With step-by-step instruction accompanied by detailed photographs,
Boxing for Beginners
shows you how to:
Master punches like the jab, right cross, left hook, and uppercut
Master punches like the jab, right cross, left hook, and uppercut
Throw well-timed combination punches with ease
Throw well-timed combination punches with ease
Develop blocking, slipping, and ducking techniques
Develop blocking, slipping, and ducking techniques
Use the jump rope to improve your overall level of physical fitness
Use the jump rope to improve your overall level of physical fitness
Properly warm up using dynamic stretching techniques
Properly warm up using dynamic stretching techniques
Improve your bag work with single punch drills, footwork movement drills, and free round drills
Improve your bag work with single punch drills, footwork movement drills, and free round drills
Spar with a partner and succeed in one-on-one competition
Spar with a partner and succeed in one-on-one competition
Plus, you'll discover how to develop a personalized workout schedule that incorporates a wide range of conditioning exercises and cool down stretches.
So what are you waiting for? Take the next step toward your fitness and boxing goals, and let
Boxing for Beginners
strengthen your mind, sharpen your reflexes, and give you that mean right hook you've always wanted.
description: Billy Finegan is a Golden Gloves Champion, as well as member of the Olympic team and a fitness and boxing teacher. He is actively involved in the Arnold USA Boxing Invitational.
Courtney Clark teaches fitness seminars around the country and at Tokey Hill Martial Arts Center in Roslyn, NY. She has ghostwritten three books on golf and is currently writing a book on baseball.
